title.narrative: Integrated Solar & Energy Storage Project, through Power Engineers, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant is funding a feasibility study for the Thai energy company, Blue Solar Farm 1 Co., Ltd. ("Blue Solar") to support the development of a solar photovoltaic power plant with an integrated energy storage system in Suphan Buri Province, Thailand. The feasibility study will evaluate the technical, financial, and other key elements of the project and provide the necessary analysis and documentation required for financing and implementation. Implementation of the project will support Thailand's goal to increase private sector investment in the renewable energy sector and help to catalyze new opportunities for energy storage deployment in Southeast Asia.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: This contract funds a Training Program to introduce delegates from the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT) to U.S. technology, regulations and best practices in energy sector modernization. The Training Program delegation will travel to up to three cities in the United States in order to meet with U.S. companies and receive training on new technologies and management best practices to approach todays energy landscape.

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will familiarize delegates from the State Railway of Thailand (SRT) and relevant Thai entities with U.S. operational best practices and advanced technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of Thailands railway system. title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Utility Data Management Strategy and Implementation Plan, through Electric Power Research Institute, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance (TA) for the Provincial Electricity Authority (PEA), a state-owned power distribution company in Thailand, to develop a comprehensive Common Information Model (CIM)-based data management strategy and implementation plan. The TA will position PEA to launch an enterprise-wide initiative to build the robust data management capability it needs to address the challenges of safe, reliable and cost-effective management of its electricity distribution grid.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Utility Data Management Strategy and Implementation Plan, through Electric Power Research Institute, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance (TA) for the Provincial Electricity Authority (PEA), a state-owned power distribution company in Thailand, to develop a comprehensive Common Information Model (CIM)-based data management strategy and implementation plan. The TA will position PEA to launch an enterprise-wide initiative to build the robust data management capability it needs to address the challenges of safe, reliable and cost-effective management of its electricity distribution grid. PEA has selected the Electrical Power Research Institute, Inc. (EPRI) to serve as the sole-source contractor to perform the TA.

title.narrative: Training - Worldwide: GPI Procurement Technical Assistance Program for Thailand, through Gas Technology Institute

description.narrative: The Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Thailand is a national-level Program aimed to train Thai procurement officials on international best practices in procurement to obtain the greatest value for money for public investments. The Procurement Assistance Program is made up of four components: (1) A Virtual Training Series composed of up to 10 webinars; (2) a three day In-Country Workshop in Bangkok; (3) a 12-13-calendar day Study Tour to the United States for public procurement leaders; and (4) a Virtual Forum to bring together all participants from the respective training activities for a discussion on change management. The goal of the Program is to build upon technical skills required to be able to procure infrastructure utilizing value-based procurement mechanisms and life-cycle cost analysis.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - SCG Fleet Decarbonization Project, through Black & Veatch Holding Company

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for SCG International Corporation Co., Ltd. (SCG), the largest conglomerate in Thailand, to determine the viability of transitioning their industrial and commercial fleet to electric vehicles (EVs). This feasibility study would create a roadmap for decarbonizing SCGs fleet of over 24,000 vehicles and developing supporting EV charging infrastructure spread over 600 sites. The Study would be undertaken on a sole-source basis by Black & Veatch Management Consulting, LLC.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Phuket Smart City Technical Assistance, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant to Thailands Digital Economy and Promotion Agency (DEPA) is funding technical assistance that will provide a roadmap to support the implementation of ICT infrastructure necessary for buildout of smart city projects in Phuket Province, Thailand. USTDAs grant will enable expansion of functionality for the Phuket City Data Platform; upgrade of Phuket Provinces command center capabilities to improve city services and emergency communications systems; and modernization of core ICT infrastructure, including fiberoptic networks, data servers, cloud migration, cybersecurity, and 5G deployment.

description.narrative: This grant to Thailand's Digital Economy and Promotion Agency (DEPA) is funding technical assistance that will provide a roadmap to support the implementation of ICT infrastructure necessary for buildout of smart city projects in Phuket Province, Thailand. USTDA's grant will enable expansion of functionality for the Phuket City Data Platform; upgrade of Phuket Province's command center capabilities to improve city services and emergency communications systems; and modernization of core ICT infrastructure, including fiberoptic networks, data servers, cloud migration, cybersecurity, and 5G deployment.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Vao Energy Plastic Recycling Plant Feasibility Study, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for VAO Energy Co., Ltd., a private energy developer, to develop a plastic recycling plant using pyrolysis in Thailand (Project). The purpose of this study is to select a pyrolysis technology and develop a continuous plastic recycling plant to process up to one hundred and fifty metric tons per day of plastic waste in Thailand and to produce pyrolysis oil as a value-added product.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Vajiralongkorn Dam Pumped Storage Hydropower Plant Feasibility Study, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT), a state-owned utility, to assess the technical and economic viability of retrofitting the Vajiralongkorn Dam in western Thailand into a grid-connected pumped storage hydropower (PSH) plant. The PSH plant would provide a clean energy generation source and energy storage solution to support Thailand's energy transition.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Low-Emissions Shunting Locomotives Feasibility Study, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (FS) to support the State Railway of Thailand (SRT) in assessing the viability of acquiring a fleet of low or zero-emissions shunting locations and developing related charging infrastructure to replace traditional diesel shunting locomotives in Thailand. SRT seeks to acquire approximately 36 low or zero-emissions locomotives and related charging or fueling infrastructure for use in Bangkok and other stations and railyards throughout the country. The FS will evaluate battery-electric and other low-emissions locomotive technology options and develop the technical specifications for the required battery charging or refueling infrastructure.

description.narrative: Desk Study - Implementation of GBAS Air Navigation Technology, through KED Group, LLC

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - Implementation of GBAS Air Navigation Technology, through KED Group, LLC

description.narrative: This desk study reviewed a proposal for a feasibility study to help Aeronautical Radio of Thailand Ltd. (AEROTHAI) implement precision approach operations utilizing Performance-Based Navigation (PBN) through the use of Ground Based Augmentation System (GBAS) air navigation technology at eight major airports in Thailand. AEROTHAI, a state enterprise under the Ministry of Transport, is considering deploying new Federal Aviation Administration (FAA)-certified GBAS technology to provide more precise and effective air traffic control and aeronautical communication services for airlines and airfreight operations.

description.narrative: This Orientation Visit (OV) introduces Thai healthcare officials and regulators to U.S. standards and technology options related to refurbished medical equipment. The visit includes meetings with U.S. public and private sector officials who specialize in safety and quality control for medical equipment pertaining to heart surgery, orthopedic procedures, diagnostic testing and other specialized fields.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Rail Sector Modernization, through TERA International Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This $207,268 reverse trade mission (RTM) brings Thai delegates from the rail transport sector to the U.S. to gain exposure to advanced U.S. technologies and safety best practices. The RTM includes meetings with U.S. system and service providers, including those offering technology options for locomotives and locomotive refurbishment, train control centers, multimodal transport, and signaling systems.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - Acquisition Plan for the State Railway of Thailand, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: This $7,000 Desk Study reviews a proposal for a technical assistance (TA) to develop an acquisition plan and associated tender documents for locomotives, wagons and locomotive refurbishment for the State Railway of Thailand (SRT) for the 2013-2020 timeframe. The Office of Transport and Traffic Policy and Planning (OTP), the designated authority to approve SRTs budget, has requested USTDA support to assist SRT realize its short-term and long-term investment to ensure its reliability of service and successful modernization. OTP anticipates that the TA will provide an expert assessment of future demand for cargo and passenger rail transport, and recommendations regarding future SRT fleet specification and acquisition solutions.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency
